Here "heart" refers to the person. The heart that responded to God is spoken of as if it were water stirred up by a storm.  AT: "who responded to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The craftsmen told Moses ... commanded us to do."
tn.text: The can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "The craftsmen told Moses that the people were bringing much more than enough for doing the work that Yahweh has commanded them to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
"The men working on the sanctuary told Moses"

tn.ref: So all the craftsmen ... joined to each other
tn.text: For 38:8-10 see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:01|26:1-3]].

tn.ref: ten curtains made from fine linen
tn.text: These curtains are sheets of cloth woven and sewed together so that they can hang to form a wall or tent.

loops of blue cloth
These were large, heavy sections of woven cloth that were used to form the covering and dividing walls of the tabernacle. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:26:01|26:01]].
